results.title: Mary and Max: The Exhibition: interview with Adam Elliot March 2010

video_links.name: Mary and Max: The Exhibition: interview with Adam Elliot March 2010

results.brief_description: Oscar winning animation director and writer Adam Elliot speaks candidly about his stop frame animation processes and, more importantly, about why he makes films. Adam also talks about the challenges he faced during the making of his first feature film ‘Mary and Max’.
results.title_for_label: Mary and Max: The Exhibition: interview with Adam Elliot March 2010

results.title: Raj Roy interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

video_links.name: Raj Roy interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'

results.brief_description: As Head of Film at MoMA (The Museum of Modern Art), New York, Raj Roy discusses the role of the film department including acquisitions, exhibitions, research, and preservation. Roy then speaks of his broad involvement in ‘Tim Burton: The Exhibition’, including the challenge of selecting the chosen artworks from tens of thousands of archived pieces. His main hope for the exhibition is that it will spark the creativity of budding artists and create the next Tim Burton.
results.description: As Head of Film at MoMA (The Museum of Modern Art), New York, Raj Roy discusses the role of the film department including acquisitions, exhibitions, research, and preservation. Roy then speaks of his broad involvement in ‘Tim Burton: The Exhibition’, including the challenge of selecting the chosen artworks from tens of thousands of archived pieces. His main hope for the exhibition is that it will spark the creativity of budding artists and create the next Tim Burton.

results.title: Mark Rosenthal in conversation with William Kentridge

video_links.name: Mark Rosenthal in conversation with William Kentridge

results.brief_description:
Mark Rosenthal, curator of the ‘William Kentridge: Five Themes’ exhibition, joins world renowned artist and filmmaker William Kentridge in conversation days before the official opening of the exhibition. Kentridge talks about becoming an artist in the apartheid era of South Africa, how he developed his art practice and the importance of the studio as a place for safe stupidity.

This is a rare opportunity to hear one of the world’s most renowned moving image artists discuss his remarkable work.
results.title_for_label: Mark Rosenthal in conversation with William Kentridge

results.title: Jeff Lindsay in conversation with Sue Turnball: Dark Tales, Serial Archetypes
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI

video_links.name: Jeff Lindsay in conversation with Sue Turnball: Dark Tales, Serial Archetypes

results.brief_description:
Jeff Lindsay, author and creator of our favourite serial killer ‘Dexter’, is joined in conversation with Professor Sue Turnbull, as they explore the renaissance of macabre fairytales in popular culture.

Jeff Lindsay and Sue Turnbull touched on many of the themes covered in the ‘Fairytales Re-imagined’ symposium, providing a fascinatingly insightful discussion centred around the development of fairy tale motifs in popular culture.
results.title_for_label: Jeff Lindsay in conversation with Sue Turnball: Dark Tales, Serial Archetypes

results.title: Spectacle: Interview with Curators Jonathan Wells and Meg Grey Wells
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Shelley Matulick and ACMI

video_links.name: Spectacle: Interview with Curators Jonathan Wells and Meg Grey Wells

results.brief_description:
“How many exhibitions would have the range of Bob Dylan to Kanye West?” (Jonathan Wells)
Flux Curators Jonathan Wells and Meg Grey Wells share what inspired ‘Spectacle: The Music Video Exhibition’, the challenges in bringing over 300 clips into an exhibition context and their favourite areas in the exhibition.
Created as part of ‘Spectacle: The Music Video Exhibition’ 26 September 2013 - 23 February 2014.

results.title: London 1942
results.creator_credit: Ken Annakin, Peter Tanner, Ralph Keene, Greenpark Productions and Verity Films
results.brief_description: A Picture of Wartime London: “A picture of London in 1942 showing a cheerful though bomb-scarred city. The streets are full of British and Allied servicemen. In the parks there are allotments; tomatoes grow on roof tops. The film shows Londoners in the Home Guard and Civil Defence. It ends with scenes of London after dark.” (Source: Films of Britain - British Council Film Department Catalogue - 1942-1943)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Annakin, Peter Tanner, Ralph Keene, Greenpark Productions and Verity Films

results.title: Fancy that
results.creator_credit: Joan Johnstone and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: When Joan showed a photo of her new boyfriend to her mother, her mother remarked that he looked a lot like Selby Adams, a British pen friend she wrote to in World War I. Joan served in the Australian Women’s Army Service during World War II and, as a result of that service, was able to re-unite her mother with her pen friend from Britain. An amazing coincidence

results.title: An Interview with Bill Saunders
results.creator_credit: Bill Saunders and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Bill Saunders joined the Airforce with his brother when both were called up in 1941. He shares stories from this time, about his training and posting in Europe as a pilot during World War II. In his time, he flew Tigermoths and the Ansons.
results.description: Bill Saunders joined the Airforce with his brother when both were called up in 1941. He shares stories from this time, about his training and posting in Europe as a pilot during World War II. In his time, he flew Tigermoths and the Ansons.

results.title: An Interview with Norm Smithells
results.creator_credit: Norm Smithells and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Norm Smithells was a Spitfire pilot in Europe during World War II. He reflects on flying and fighting the Germans during this time and shares his history as there are not many pilots left.
results.description: Norm Smithells was a Spitfire pilot in Europe during World War II. He reflects on flying and fighting the Germans during this time and shares his history as there are not many pilots left.

results.title: An Interview with Douglas Margetts
results.creator_credit: Douglas Margetts and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Douglas Margetts served as part of the Australian 6th Division Signals and served in the Middle East and New Guinea in World War II. He relates his experiences as part of “In our words”, a Digital Storytelling workshop for Victorian war veterans.
results.description: Douglas Margetts served as part of the Australian 6th Division Signals and served in the Middle East and New Guinea in World War II. He relates his experiences as part of “In our words”, a Digital Storytelling workshop for Victorian war veterans.
